intro: Spilanthes iabadicensis, commonly known as the Ibaden buttercup, is a flowering plant native to the highland regions of Ecuador. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its yellow flowers and pinnately compound leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
